questions.question: Read the following passage and answer the question that follows.
options: Click here if you have reviewed all the instructions and question details.

questions.question: A person who aspires to lead could learn from the history of battles
options: what led the previous leaders win a battle
what made them lose a battle
the qualities and deficiencies of commanders of these battles
the strategies that they have evolved in course of these battles

questions.question: In this context, 'intelligent interpretation of current event' means
options: rational explanation of events
appropriate understanding of events
intellectual outlook on events
skilful interpretation of events

questions.question: The expression 'more than a modicum of truth' means
options: some truth
much truth
more than a small amount of truth
nothing but truth

questions.question: According to the writer, a study of famous battles of history would
options: be beneficial to wise men
provide food to modern leaders for reflection
be more useful than a general knowledge of ancient history
help us understand the art of modern warfare

questions.question: A knowledge of history is necessary to interpret current problems because
options: they have roots in the past
they can be contrasted with the past events
they may be repetitions of past events
only then they can be put in a proper context

questions.question: Read the following passage and answer the question that follows.
options: Click here if you have reviewed all the instructions and question details.

questions.question: Evaluation of news would imply
options: less dependence on modern systems of communication
more careful analysis of each news story and its value
separating beans from junk
discriminating horrors from disasters

questions.question: The writer of the above passage
options: seems to be happy with the contemporary arrangements for circulating news
is shocked by the casual stories about horrors and disasters reported in the newspapers
wants better evaluation of news before publication
wants to put his foot down on news stories

questions.question: In the above passage, the phrase 'amounts to a row of beans' means that the news
options: is weak and often wanting entirely
deserves no one's attention
should travel the wires
is junk dressed up as real news

questions.question: Newspapers lack a sense of discrimination because
options: they do not separate the real news from mere sensationalism
they have to accept whatever is received on the wires
limited manpower makes serious evolution impossible
people don't see the difference between 'junk' and 'real' news

questions.question: The passage implies that
options: there has to be censorship on newspapers
there is no point in having censorship
newspapers always dress up junk to look meaningful
one has to be strict in selecting news items
